body_html:
Since we have automatic deconstruction, stacked tensor would work for most sequence scenarios as well. Is there a good reason to return specifically a sequence? Would be interesting to find out about NumPy devs motivation.

Btw, torch.meshgrid does not currently support torch.meshgrid(x, y) (user must pass [x, y]), contrary to NumPy.
body_text:
Since we have automatic deconstruction, stacked tensor would work for most sequence scenarios as well. Is there a good reason to return specifically a sequence? Would be interesting to find out about NumPy devs motivation.
Btw, torch.meshgrid does not currently support torch.meshgrid(x, y) (user must pass [x, y]), contrary to NumPy.
body:
Since we have automatic deconstruction, stacked tensor would work for most sequence scenarios as well. Is there a good reason to return specifically a sequence? Would be interesting to find out about NumPy devs motivation.

Btw, `torch.meshgrid` does not currently support `torch.meshgrid(x, y)` (user must pass `[x, y]`), contrary to NumPy.
